unnormalised: Okay, so you're planning to visit Delhi? That's awesome! A lot of important govt offices are located there. Finding them can be a bit of a hassle if you don't know where to look, though. You’ll probably need to find something, right?
normalised: Okay, so you're planning to visit Delhi? That's awesome! A lot of important government offices are located there. Finding them can be a bit of a hassle if you don't know where to look, though. You'll probably need to find something, right?

unnormalised: For instance, the Parliament of India is located at Sansad Marg, New Delhi, 110001. It’s kinda near Connaught Place, so you can probably take the metro and then an auto-rickshaw. Keep in mind the traffic on Parliament Street can be crazy during peak hours though. The Supreme Court of India, Tilak Marg, New Delhi, 110201, is another important landmark you might be interested in checking out. It's pretty close to India Gate, so you could combine the two visits.
normalised: For instance, the Parliament of India is located at Sansad Marg, New Delhi, one hundred and ten thousand and one. It's kind of near Connaught Place, so you can probably take the metro and then an auto-rickshaw. Keep in mind the traffic on Parliament Street can be crazy during peak hours though. The Supreme Court of India, Tilak Marg, New Delhi, one hundred and ten thousand two hundred and one, is another important landmark you might be interested in checking out. It's pretty close to India Gate, so you could combine the two visits.

unnormalised: If you need to visit the Reserve Bank of India, their Delhi office is at 6, Sansad Marg, New Delhi, 110001. Make sure you double-check the address cause there’s a Parliament Street and a Sansad Marg, both can get confusing. Also, if you’re trying to find the office of the Election Commission of India, it's located at Nirvachan Sadan, Ashok Road, New Delhi, 110001. It's on a pretty busy road so best to avoid driving if you can.
normalised: If you need to visit the Reserve Bank of India, their Delhi office is at six, Sansad Marg, New Delhi, one hundred and ten thousand and one. Make sure you double-check the address because there's a Parliament Street and a Sansad Marg, both can get confusing. Also, if you're trying to find the office of the Election Commission of India, it's located at Nirvachan Sadan, Ashok Road, New Delhi, one hundred and ten thousand and one. It's on a pretty busy road so best to avoid driving if you can.

unnormalised: And say you need to visit the Ministry of External Affairs? That's at South Block, Raisina Hill, New Delhi, 110011. This whole area is usually very well-guarded and secure, so be ready for security checks. The University Grants Commission (UGC) has its office at Bahadur Shah Zafar Marg, New Delhi, 110002 if you're dealing with education-related stuff.
normalised: And say you need to visit the Ministry of External Affairs? That's at South Block, Raisina Hill, New Delhi, one hundred and ten thousand and eleven. This whole area is usually very well-guarded and secure, so be ready for security checks. The University Grants Commission (U-G-C) has its office at Bahadur Shah Zafar Marg, New Delhi, one hundred and ten thousand and two if you're dealing with education-related stuff.

unnormalised: So yeah, Delhi’s got a bunch of important govt and institutional addresses scattered around. Just a bit of planning and some GPS assistance, and you'll be able to locate them without too much trouble. Remember to factor in Delhi's traffic, especially if you're travelling during office timings. Good luck with your trip!
